intro: Latrobea pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and gelatinous berries. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its haustoria. It plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for birds and insects. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant impacts on the health of its host trees.
